nodes.bodyText: I'm curious: Why did you remove / change the test case?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -13,7 +13,6 @@ Require-Bundle: org.eclipse.xtext.ide,
  org.antlr.runtime;bundle-version="[3.2.0,3.2.1)"
 Automatic-Module-Name: org.eclipse.xtext.xbase.ide
 Export-Package: .,
- bar,

nodes.bodyText:
In order to fix the other issue we had, I changed the strategy to solve the original issue a little. Before I was filtering the unused imports when adding them, but that caused a trouble with the rest of the code in ImportManager.
Now I filter them just before they are generated in the getImports method.
The test case uses the serialize method, where the filtering does not apply anymore.
nodes.diffHunk:

  org.antlr.runtime;bundle-version="[3.2.0,3.2.1)"
 Automatic-Module-Name: org.eclipse.xtext.xbase.ide
 Export-Package: .,
- bar,

nodes.bodyText: As far as I understand the purpose of the serialize method that basically means, that only import statements are filtered now, while an a potentially superfluous qualification of a reference can still occur.
